|Rank=A
|Title=Knowing the clinical signs of hypoglycaemia and correcting it
|Description=None
|Rubric=Positive diagnosis
|Contributors=Nicolas Weiss
|Order=7}}

- coma or any neurological disorder

- evoked by capillary blood glucose, confirmed by blood glucose (blood glucose < 3 mmol/L)

- emergency resucration with direct IV glucose serum (G30% 1 ampoule) if consciousness is impaired

- orally, if you are conscious enough: sugar cubes, orange juice, etc.

- revaluation

properties.question: What is the immediate treatment for a patient in a hypoglycemic coma?
properties.option_a: Administer a high dose of insulin
properties.option_b: Provide oral glucose tablets if the patient is conscious
properties.option_c: Emergency resuscitation with direct IV glucose serum (G30% 1 ampoule) if consciousness is impaired
